Six moments of silence are part of the 9/11 anniversary commemoration.

The public is invited to observe any or all of them.

Here is the list:

- 8:46 a.m. eastern time: Hijackers crash Flight 11 into the north tower.

- 9:03 a.m.: Hijackers crash United Airlines Flight 175 into the south tower.

- 9:37 a.m.: Hijackers crash American Airlines Flight 77 into the Pentagon.

- 9:59 a.m.: The south tower collapses.

- 10:03 a.m.: Passengers launch a counterattack on hijackers aboard United Airlines Flight 93. The hijackers crash the plane into an empty field near Shanksville, Pa.

- 10:28 a.m.: The north tower collapses.

Mad River Families:

We now have firm guidance from the state of Ohio in order to restart school for the 2020-2021 school year. Mad River Local Schools will communicate out the district plan during the week of July 6. The decision to restart school is not only based on the guidance we received from the state of Ohio, but also the three district-wide surveys conducted during the 4th quarter of the school year and early summer, outcomes from our district operations committee as well as statewide data collected by Fallon Research.

All school districts, including Mad River, will be making very difficult decisions in the coming weeks and we are all doing our due diligence to make the best possible decisions to maintain safety while bringing back all students into our buildings. Please remember that as we move forward. We are all impacted.

Thank you,
Mr. Wyen

Activities to receive Honorable Mention may include but are not limited to completing the SEP or K12 Prevention needs assessment, setting goals for prevention programs, planning to implement programs in the 2020-2021 school year, or implementing a program in one or a few of the required Schools of Excellence Program categories. Research has shown that offering quality prevention programs and strategies to school communities can help prevent or delay the onset of many behavioral health and mental health concerns in children.

post_text: Ms. Delong's first graders are enjoying their last week of school having fun, showing kindness, and being creative in 1st grade. They had a Puppet Talent Show for their recent Zoom meeting. The students were encouraged to make their own sock puppet, paper bag puppet, or use a puppet they had at home and share a special talent with the class. Ms. Delong's 'Marvin the Monkey' puppet shared his special alphabet song on YouTube and loved reviewing letter sounds with the kids. His special talent was he could say the alphabet backwards: "Z, Y, X, W, V, U, T, …." All of the kids had so much fun sharing their cute homemade puppets and silly talents with the class! We had 2 puppets that sang to each other, a super hero puppet fighting crime, a pirate puppet looking for a buried treasure, and lots more adorable puppets (even a real puppy) with special talents! Who says, long distance learning can't be fun? The class also enjoyed making a directed drawing of a Minion because we're all 'One in a Minion!' Happy Summer! 🙂

As we continue to work through these unprecedented times due to COVID-19, we will be changing how we typically manage our kindergarten enrollment fair. Children who are five on or before August 1, 2020, are eligible to register for kindergarten. You must reside in the Mad River Local School District to register for Mad River kindergarten. Open Enrollment will be at a later date.

If you have any questions about the enrollment process, or need assistance, please contact Mrs. Heather Shuttleworth at: heather.shuttleworth@madriverschools.org
